meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The shirkers at the office always find excuses to avoid their tasks.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was frustrated with the shirkers in the group project.
meanings.sent3: The shirkers pretended to be busy whenever the boss walked by.
meanings.sent4: The shirkers were like shadows, disappearing when there was work to be done.
meanings.sent5: The shirkers were like magnets to laziness, always pulling others in.

meanings.definition: Those who evade their duties or obligations.
meanings.sent1: The shirkers in the team meeting tried to shift blame onto others.
meanings.sent2: The company had to deal with shirkers who avoided paying their taxes.
meanings.sent3: The shirkers magically disappeared whenever chores were mentioned.
meanings.sent4: The shirkers were like slippery eels, escaping responsibility at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The shirkers were like ghosts, haunting the workplace with their absence.
